creator: uncle8rain@yahoo.com
text:
Hi!  I'm using Win 2K Pro platform and JDK1.4.1.  I need ant for JavaCC 
compiler.  When ant at the JavaCC source directory, I encounter the following 
message:

BUILD FAILED:
c:\Program Files\Java\javacc-3.2\build.xml:49: The following error occurred 
while executing this line: java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: 
com/sun/tools/javac/Main (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)

Please advise solution

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
I've never encountered this before; it is probably caused by the wrong version
of javac being picked up. Whatever, it is not an ant bug so much as a
configuration problem. 

what does ant -diagnostics say?

Looks as if either Ant or any library it uses has been compiled with JDK 5 - which
creates class version 49.0.

Does Ant work for any other sources?

Where did you get your version of Ant?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
On second glance, looks as if you were using JDK 1.5's tools.jar while running
a Java VM < 1.5.

Any idea where it could be coming from?
